panels.description: The overview panel shows the current number of acceptors, compared to the configuration; the current number of connection supervisors, compared to the configuration; and the configured number of listening sockets.
panels.title: Overview

panels.description: The current number of connections and number of active connections at a given time. Connections are active by default and can be "removed" using `ranch:remove_connection/1`.
panels.title: Connections

panels.description: The status of the acceptor processes. `exiting=1`, `suspended=2`, `runnable=3`, `garbage_collecting=4`, `running=5` and `waiting=6`.
panels.title: Status

panels.description: The status of the connection supervisors. `exiting=1`, `suspended=2`, `runnable=3`, `garbage_collecting=4`, `running=5` and `waiting=6`.
panels.title: Status

panels.description: The number of reductions of acceptor processes at a given time. The number roughly corresponds to function calls.
panels.title: Reductions

panels.description: The number of reductions of connection supervisors at a given time. The number roughly corresponds to function calls.
panels.title: Reductions

panels.description: The number of messages in the queue of acceptor processes at any given time.
panels.title: Message queue length

panels.description: The number of messages in the queue of connection supervisors at any given time.
panels.title: Message queue length

panels.description: In bytes. It is possible to obtain a per-process view of the memory usage of Ranch processes using the `ranch_proc_total_heap_size_bytes`, `ranch_proc_stack_size_bytes`, `ranch_proc_min_heap_size_bytes`, `ranch_proc_min_bin_vheap_size_bytes` and `ranch_proc_heap_size_bytes` values, filtering on the `listener`, `type` and `id`.
panels.title: Memory

panels.description: In bytes.
